channel.title: .read | my words on blacktea_extract
channel.description: Recent content in .read | my words on blacktea_extract

item.title: new_theme
item.description:
I just implemented a new the! I hope you like it.

Also I have adjusted the publication script and therefore could remove the GitHub workflow. Now its just pushing the public folder.

item.title: integrating_obsidian
item.description:
what am I even doing?

My goal here is to just write new website entries for this site in Obsidian. I just stumbled upon this blog-post of networkchuck, a content creator that sparked my interest to be more into trying out “more technical stuff” on my own.

The problem here, at least for me, was that I already had started to build my website in a more complicated way before. I just uploaded the files manually to the GitHub repository manually. Painful and probably the reason I didn’t write stuff basically at all. But I was already building with hugo and using GitHub.

item.title: the_sick_man_of_today
item.description:
what is wrong with the internet?

I just have the feeling recently, that the web is getting worse. Even more than I have thought it to be. But let me start from the beginning.

The internet, as I used to know it, has kind of ceased to exist. It used to be a place where actual humans used to interact. But recently I can’t overcome the feeling, that I - ironically - have lost the connection to actual real human people.

item.title: pessimist_optimist
item.description:
I like to think of myself as an optimist in practice, but this doesn’t mean that I shouldn’t be pessimistic about humanity as a whole. Always.

Just look us, doing all the same shit over and over again. Nothing to be left with, exept weltschmerz.

cred. Max Horkheimer
